go_data.justification: The muscle-specific ubiquitin ligase MuRF1 has recently been shown to specifically inhibit PPARalpha, but not PPARbeta/delta or PPARgamma1, activity in vivo through mono-ubiquitination.
MuRF1 inhibited PPARalpha-regulated fatty acid oxidation both in vitro and in vivo by multi-mono-ubiquitination of lysines adjacent to the newly identified nuclear export sequence in PPARalpha.
MuRF1 had an inhibitory effect on PPARalpha in cardiomyocytes by enhancing nuclear export, not degradation.

go_data.term: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
go_data.justification: MuRF1 inhibits PPARalpha activity in the cardiomyocyte through mono-ubiquitination that enhanced nuclear export without promoting PPARalpha degradation.
The ubiquitin ligase MuRF1 regulates PPARalpha activity in the heart by enhancing nuclear export via monoubiquitination, implying cytoplasmic involvement.
